name: ruck
content:
ruck noun
(CROWD)
the ruck UK
Add to word list
Add to word list
ordinary people or things, that you consider boring: Carter's brilliant second novel lifted her out of the ruck. Come out from the ruck of grumblers, who just criticize and do nothing, and try to do something to help.
[ C ]
  sports
  specialized a group of players in rugby who are all together around the ball when it is on the ground: The front row is doing better in the scrum but not so good in the ruck. He served time in the sin-bin for using hands in the ruck. Compare
maul
mikedabell/E+/GettyImages
